抗议警察暴行后的一年震惊的企业世界令人醒来的工作场所的种族股权问题，快速公司努力看看改变的东西 - 以及该国最大的技术公司内部的内容。
   Tech Tech Project的Black的基石与插头合作，涵盖了黑色创新经济的出版物 - 是一项调查，这是一个最大，最重要的美国技术公司中42家的调查，拥有超过1000名员工的快速公司盖子。截至今年5月6日，这些公司的市场资本增资范围从28亿美元（Yelp）至2.1万亿美元（Apple）;我们的财务数据截至6月14日。
 三十七种技术巨头对我们的疑问作出回应，并同意参加该项目。条纹和Roku拒绝参与，而Tesla，Spacex和Coinbase没有回应重复的要求。对于未参与的公司，我们搜索了有关承诺或政策变更的任何公共信息，并在最终项目中包含这些调查结果。
 这种数据集的块，它封装了这些公司所作的公共财务承诺以及对去年的政策和程序所做的更改，在数据可视化中突出显示，您可以在此处看到。但是值得打开这个数据更多。
  在去年的技术最大的趋势之一是在各个科技公司的墙壁中提高种族股权的财务承诺，以及全国各地。虽然一些公司在以前的情况下对种族司法和多样性和多样性，公平和包容性（Dei）作出了承诺，但它从未在2020年的相同规模中发生。值得注意的是，在2014年在Ferguson杀死Michael Brown Jr后，没有主要科技公司发表了任何陈述或捐款（虽然Twitter的Jack Dorsey当时是执行主席，但对此进行了推文并参加了人的抗议活动）。
 累积地，我们调查的科技巨头在2020年和2021年的DEI中致力于各种形式致力于DEI。这些资金的最大块 -  29亿美元，或75％ - 走向支持黑人企业的举措。包括专门向黑名大学部署的风险资本资金，以及专门为黑人供应商专用的资金。
 11％的承诺，总共4.225亿美元，正在朝着种族司法组织，往往采取直接捐赠的形式。约有10％的承诺，3.751亿美元，致力于教育举措。这些承诺有时被诬陷为解决“管道问题” - 经常有争议的声称技术的多样性困境是由于缺乏合格的黑人雇用。剩余的金额已被分配给未指定或内部承诺;很少有公司分享他们的内部Dei花费。此外，一些公司，包括Microsoft，Netflix和Yelp，包括贷款和存款作为其承诺的一部分。 
虽然这些数字似乎很大，但将公司的承诺与其营业收入进行比较是很重要的。我们看了一个回答我们的调查的公司，在2020年的营业收入超过1亿美元，并分析了他们的利润超过了他们对种族股权的总承诺的日子。结果是鲜明的。
 致力于1亿美元的Apple将在不到一天的时间内使货币在利润中。但即使是最大的科技公司也符合大幅度的微软（772.5百万美元），字母/谷歌（41.18亿美元）和Facebook（1.47亿美元） - 使他们的承诺在三到六天之间获得利润。
 列表上有一些突出奖励。 PayPal在2020年在2020年营业收入制作了33亿美元，将需要近两个月的利润来支付其实质性5.35亿美元的承诺。此外，在2020年营业收入4.22亿美元的Salesforce致力于绝大多数它 -  40220万美元至各种多样性和股权举措。
  这些比较揭示了公司如何在他们制造的金额的背景下最好地了解;在这种背景下，即使是最大的美元金额也很小。随着监视专家Chris Gilliard将它放了，“我甚至没有沙发靠垫钱。”
  除了要求公司对股权的财务承诺之外，我们还向他们询问了一系列关于他们的政策的问题，可以表明公司试图改善其DEI。 （重要的是要注意，并非所有政策变化都是平等的。批评者建议有些动作，比如使JuneteNth度假，不要导致公司文化的系统性变化）。
 一个发生的运动是推动董事会带来更多的黑人，我们发现这反映在数据中。虽然71％的经过调查的公司目前拥有黑板会员，但其中37％的公司于2020年或2021年任命他们的第一个黑板成员。调查的二十九家公司目前没有黑板成员。
  我们发现科技公司因需要反偏见或反种族主义培训而分开。根据我们的调查，48％的公司需要所有员工。三十一百分点使其在2020年或2021年开始的所有员工都必须强制。这是35％公司的所有员工不强制。在此桶中包含的公司是决定使其强制所有经理，或所有雇用管理人员，而不是所有员工。例如，Uber Spokesperson告诉我们，对领导者无意识的偏见和微产权培训，并有一个培训计划，专注于新员工和经理船上的反偏见，但不要求所有员工培训，因为研究表明它没有“所需的影响”。 
一个值得注意的转变，即刚开始发生的是公司的Dei Head报告;对于广大回应我们的调查的公司，Dei Head向首席人员或同等学历的报告。一个小的少数少数少数手包括Facebook，Pinterest，Peloton和Etsy  - 将他们的Dei报告负责人报告到CEO或运营负责人。在种族正义抗议之后，在2020年或2021年进行了这些变化。只有一家公司 -  yelp-在抗议活动之前有这种报告结构。自2016年以来，它的Dei负责人向COO报告。
 为员工Juneteenth作为付费公司假期是去年发生的另一个变化。从2020年开始，大约一半的公司接近了Juneteenth的办公室。没有公司在此之前提供Juneteenth作为假期。
  总体而言，我们发现，在夏季2020年抗议之后，大约三分之二的公司在夏季抗议后做了一些Dei政策。应该指出的是，有几家公司已经在2020年之前询问了我们在原位提出的政策。
 一年不是很长一段时间来创造系统性变化，它仍然不清楚我们编目的任何更改是否会结束Tech的低估和利用黑人员工的长途记录。基于科技项目中的黑色专业的访谈，工作人员只想得到公平的支付和对待;如果公司无法满足这些基本要求，那么拥有一个黑板成员，给每个人带薪假期，或捐赠数百万肯定不会解决问题。
 我们正在发布和分析这些数据，以持有这些公司对其承诺负责，因为没有透明度变化将进一步遥不可及。快速公司将继续遵循这些承诺如何在未来几年中影响技术人员和用户。
note_en:
One year after protests against police brutality shook much of the corporate world awake to the problems of racial equity in the workplace,  Fast Company took a hard look at what’s changed—and what hasn’t—within the biggest technology companies in the country.
   A cornerstone of the Black in Tech project—created in collaboration with   The Plug, a publication covering the Black innovation economy—was a survey that went out to 42 of the largest and most important U.S.-based technology companies with over 1,000 employees that  Fast Company covers. These companies’ market capitalizations, as of May 6 of this year, range from $2.8 billion (Yelp) to $2.1 trillion (Apple); our financial data is current as of June 14.
 Thirty-seven technology giants responded to our queries and agreed to participate in the project. Stripe and Roku declined to participate, and Tesla, SpaceX, and Coinbase did not respond to repeated requests. For companies that did not participate, we searched for any public information about commitments or policy changes, and included those findings in the final project.
 Pieces of this data set, which encapsulates the public financial commitments made by these companies, as well as the changes made to their policies and procedures in the last year, are highlighted in data visualizations, which you can see  here. But it’s worth unpacking this data more.
  One of the biggest trends in tech over the last year is financial commitments to improving racial equity both within individual tech companies’ walls, as well as across the country at large. While some companies have made commitments to racial justice and diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) before, it has never happened collectively on the same scale it did in 2020. Notably, after police killed Michael Brown Jr. in Ferguson in 2014, no major tech companies  made any statements or donations (though Twitter’s Jack Dorsey, who was executive chairman at the time, did tweet about it and attended the protests in person).
 Cumulatively, the tech giants we surveyed have committed a total of $3.8 billion toward DEI in 2020 and 2021, in various forms. The largest chunk of these funds—$2.9 billion, or 75%—have gone toward initiatives that support Black-owned businesses. That includes venture capital funding deployed specifically toward Black founders, as well as funds earmarked for Black-owned suppliers.
 Eleven percent of the commitments, a total of $422.5 million, is going toward racial justice organizations, often taking the form of direct donations to nonprofits. About 10% of the commitments, $375.1 million, were committed to educational initiatives. These sorts of commitments are sometimes framed as an effort to solve the  “pipeline problem”—the  often-contested claim that tech’s diversity woes are due to a lack of qualified Black people to hire. The remaining money has been allocated to undesignated or internal commitments; very few companies shared their internal DEI spend. In addition, a few companies, including Microsoft, Netflix, and Yelp, included loans and deposits into Black-owned banks as part of their commitments.
  While these numbers seem substantial, it’s important to compare companies’ commitments to their operating income. We took a look at companies which answered our survey that had an operating income of over $100 million in 2020, and analyzed how many days it would take for their profits to surpass their total commitments to racial equity. The results were stark.
 Apple, which committed $100 million, will make that money in profit in less than a day. But even the largest tech companies that committed substantially more—like Microsoft ($772.5 million), Alphabet/Google ($418 million), and Facebook ($347 million)—make their commitments back in profit in between three and six days.
 There are some standouts on the list. PayPal, which made $3.3 billion in operating income in 2020, would take almost two months of profit to pay for its substantial $535 million commitment. In addition, Salesforce, which made $422 million in operating income in 2020, has committed the vast majority of it—$402.2 million—to various diversity and equity initiatives.
  These comparisons reveal how companies’ financial commitments are best understood in the context of how much money they make; even some of the largest dollar amounts begin to look small in this context. As surveillance expert Chris Gilliard  puts it, “i t’s not even couch-cushion money to them.”
  Along with asking companies about their financial commitments to equity, we also asked them a range of questions about their policies that can indicate a company is attempting to improve its DEI. (It’s important to note that not all policy changes are equal. Critics have suggested that some moves, like making Juneteenth a holiday, don’t result in a systemic change to company culture).
 One movement that’s taken place is a push to bring more Black people on to boards of directors, and we found this reflected in the data. While 71% of companies surveyed currently have a Black board member, 37% of those companies appointed their first Black board member in 2020 or 2021. Twenty-nine percent of companies surveyed do not currently have a Black board member.
  We found that tech companies are split on requiring anti-bias or anti-racism training. According to our survey, 48% of companies require it for all employees. Thirty-one percent made it mandatory for all employees starting in 2020 or 2021. It is not mandatory for all employees at 35% of companies. Included in this bucket are companies that have made the decision to make it mandatory for all managers, or all hiring managers, but not for all employees. For instance, an Uber spokesperson told us it has mandatory training on unconscious bias and microaggressions for leaders and has a training program focused on anti-bias for new employee and manager onboarding, but doesn’t require that training for all employees because  research suggests it doesn’t have the “desired impact.”
 One noteworthy shift that’s just starting to take place is who a company’s DEI head reports to; for the vast majority of the companies who responded to our survey, the DEI head reports to the chief people officer, or equivalent. A small handful—including Facebook, Pinterest, Peloton, and Etsy—have their head of DEI reporting to either the CEO or the head of operations. These changes were made in 2020 or 2021, after the racial justice protests. Only one company—Yelp—had this kind of reporting structure in place before the protests. Its head of DEI has reported to the COO since 2016.
 Giving employees Juneteenth as a paid company holiday is another change that’s occurred in the last year. About half of companies surveyed now close their offices for Juneteenth, starting in 2020. No company had offered Juneteenth as a holiday previously.
  Overall, we found that about two-thirds of companies had made some kind of DEI policy change after the summer 2020 protests. It should be noted that several companies already had the policies we asked about in place before 2020.
 A year isn’t a long time to create systemic change, and it’s still unclear if any of the changes we’ve catalogued will end tech’s long track record of undervaluing and exploiting Black employees. Based on the interviews featured in the  Black in Tech project, workers just want to be paid and treated fairly; if companies can’t meet those basic requirements, having a Black board member, giving everyone a paid holiday, or donating millions certainly won’t solve the problem.
 We are publishing and analyzing this data to hold these companies accountable for their promises, since without transparency change will be even further out of reach.  Fast Company will continue to follow how these commitments impact tech workers and users in the years to come.
title: 37科技巨头调查：3.8亿美元致力于2020年和2021年的多样性努力，〜2/3在夏季2020年抗议后做了某种DEI政策变化
title_en: Survey of 37 tech giants: $3.8B committed to diversity efforts in 2020 and 2021, ~2/3 had made some kind of DEI policy change after the summer 2020 protests

在Deloitte的工作人员将能够在他们想要的任何地方工作时，在Covid限制缓解并从家庭指导下工作时，都会被报废。
 四家公司的工作人员不会有义务从办公室工作每周最少的天数，这是德勤竞争对手的典型回应。
 大约15,000名德勤工作人员对大四公司工作未来的内部调查作出了回应，其中超过80％的人，这些人们希望从德勤办公室工作两天或更少每周工作。
     超过90％的德勤的员工队伍表示，“选择”和“灵活性”应该是经营未来如何运作的核心。
 德勤高级合作伙伴和首席执行官理查德休斯顿说：“大流行的影响深刻地改变了我们的生活方式，并非最不重要的方式。去年确实表明，在平衡工作和个人生活方面，一个尺寸不适合所有。
 “它还表明，我们可以信任我们的人民在何时以及他们工作的时间内做出正确的选择。”
 他继续说：“一旦政府取消了所有的Covid-19限制，我们恢复了全职能力，我们将让我们的人民选择他们需要做最佳工作的地方，与他们的专业人士平衡个人责任。“ 
Deloitte表示，当限制时，其办事处将主要用于团队协作，培训和客户会议。
     许多城市公司已宣布计划通过大流行后的混合结构，工作人员要求每周在办公室花一些时间。
 竞争对手KPMG和EY已经表示，每周将在办公室平均两天的工作人员，而竞争对手PWC估计的工作人员将在两到三天之间在办公室。
 政府目前正在咨询可能阻止雇主从迫使员工进入办公室的计划的计划，除非他们可以证明这是必不可少的。
 Whitehall Source告诉邮件：“我们正在研究介绍一个灵活工作的默认权利。这将涵盖父母的合理请求等事情开始迟到，因此他们可以在托儿所下放孩子。
 “但在办公室工人的情况下，它也将涵盖在家中工作 - 除非雇主可以表现出某人不应该的好理性，否则将是默认权利。”
   政府已经击败了报告，总理被理解为反对在最终锁定限制之外的家中的大规模工作。 
标签：大四
note_en:
Staff working at Deloitte will be able to work wherever they want when Covid restrictions are eased and work from home guidance is scrapped.
 Staff at the Big Four firm will not be obligated to work from the office for a minimum number of days per week, as has been a typical response of Deloitte’s competitors.
 Some 15,000 Deloitte staff responded to an internal survey about the future of work at the Big Four firm, with more than 80 per cent of those saying they expected to work from a Deloitte office for two days or fewer per week.
     More than 90 per cent of Deloitte’s workforce said ‘choice’ and ‘flexibility’ should be at the heart of how the business operates in future.
 Deloitte senior partner and chief executive Richard Houston said: “The impact of the pandemic has profoundly changed our way of life, not least in the way we work. The last year has really shown that one size does not fit all when it comes to balancing work and personal lives.
 “It has also shown that we can trust our people to make the right choice in when, how and where they work.”
 He continued: “Once the Government has lifted all of the Covid-19 restrictions and we’re back up to full office capacity, we will let our people choose where they need to be to do their best work, in balance with their professional and personal responsibilities.”
 Deloitte said when restrictions are eased its offices will principally be used for team collaboration, training and client meetings.
     Many City companies have announced plans to adopt a hybrid structure post-pandemic, with staff asked to spend some time in the office each week.
 Competitors KPMG and EY have said staff will spend on average two days in the office each week, while rival PwC estimated staff will be in the office between two and three days.
 The government is currently consulting on plans that could prevent employers from forcing staff to come into the office unless they can prove it is essential.
 A Whitehall source told The Mail: “We are looking at introducing a default right to flexible working. That would cover things like reasonable requests by parents to start late so they can drop their kids at childcare.
 “But in the case of office workers in particular it would also cover working from home – that would be the default right unless the employer could show good reason why someone should not.”
   The government has shot down the reports, with the Prime Minister understood to be against large-scale working from home beyond final lockdown restrictions.
     																Tags:  Big Four
title: 德罗特告诉员工他们可以永远在家工作
title_en: Deloitte tells staff they can work from home forever

 似乎现在已经回来了，但从我看到它是美丽的！
  舞台＆gt;走向走廊＆gt;点击箭头＆gt;后频弹出！ @jowyang @garylhenderson pic.twitter.com/5bjfvlg7t5.
 虽然BackChannel屏幕完全是空白的，但没有如此文本输入框，但它看起来是该公司正在努力建立俱乐部首席执行官Paul Davison的文字聊天功能，以前在公司市政厅讨论过。
 “......我认为有这么多人一直努力做DM背信道，这么多人想要加深与人的友谊和关系，并做各种各样的东西 - 我认为这是我们应该拥有的东西，“戴维森说。
 这里的评论@pdavison在最近的市政厅期间为@clubhouse提供了对@clubhouse的备份（人们可以互相dm的exthelnesel。
 Clubhouse联合创始人继续说，建立适合应用程序用例的功能不会微不足道，不会立即发生。如果该应用程序将添加传统的一对一DMS或更开放的组文本聊天功能，他还拒绝详细说明。 
当达到评论时，俱乐部院并没有从假设拐点围绕角落的假设中劝阻TechCrunch，而是发出了COY声明。  “作为我们产品建设过程的一部分，Clubhouse经常探索和测试潜在的功能，”俱乐部发言人告诉TechCrunch。 “这些功能有时会成为应用的一部分，有时他们不会。”  Spotify的新俱乐部HodeCat App Greentroom提供自己的直播文本聊天室，用户可以通过在应用程序中滑动来访问，使其在俱乐部屋提供的一系列灵活性。 从Clubhouse Backhannel功能的外观，它也生活在通过滑动访问的窗口中，但这显然有可能发生变化。
note_en:
Wow looks like accidental update of  @clubhouse enabled in app backchannel & switch of side bar & full experience.
 Seems it’s rolled back now but from what I saw it was beautiful!!
  On stage > move to hallway > hit arrow > back channel popped up!  @jowyang  @GaryLHenderson  pic.twitter.com/5bJfVlg7t5
 While the backchannel screen was totally blank without so much as a text entry box, it looks like the company is working on building out the text chat feature that Clubhouse CEO Paul Davison  previously discussed in a company town hall.
 “…. I think that there are so many people who do DM backchannels all the time, so many people who want to deepen friendships and relationships with people and do all sorts of other stuff — I think this is something that we should have,” Davison said.
 Here's a comment where  @pdavison mentions the need for a backchannel of sorts (where people can DM each other) for  @Clubhouse during a recent town hall.
 The Clubhouse co-founder went on to say that building the feature to suit the app’s use cases won’t be trivial and wouldn’t be happening right away. He also declined to elaborate on if the app would add traditional one-on-one DMs or a more open group text chat feature.
 When reached for comment, Clubhouse didn’t dissuade TechCrunch from the assumption that a messaging feature is around the corner, but issued a coy statement.
 “As part of our product building process, Clubhouse regularly explores and tests potential features,” a Clubhouse spokesperson told TechCrunch. “These functions sometimes become part of the app, sometimes they don’t.”
 Spotify’s  new Clubhouse copycat app Greenroom offers its own live text chatroom that users can access by swiping right in the app, giving it a bit of flexibility that Clubhouse has yet to offer. From the looks of the Clubhouse backchannel feature, it also lives in window accessed through swiping, though that’s obviously subject to change.

金星可能是地狱，但不要称之为死星球。在高达471°C的表面温度和表面压力比地球上大100倍，新的研究表明该球仍然可能是地质活跃的。这对认为它曾经有过托管的人（或者它仍然可以能够）的人来说，这是令人鼓舞的新闻。
  地球的岩石圈（地壳和上部地幔）由“板材”制成，彼此走向并撞击，导致山脉，深海沟渠和火山和地震活动。这种构造活性也在碳循环中发挥着重要作用，在生态系统中释放并重新吸收碳的过程;通过调节大气中的二氧化碳量，它有助于保持行星凉爽，舒适。
  到目前为止，科学家们从未观察过类似的东西。但我们从来没有能够统治它，因为它很难做出这个地球的科学观察（它的厚云遮挡它的表面，以及我们将在几个小时内融化的任何航天器都很可能融化）。在今天在PNA发表的新发现中，科学家认为他们最终发现了金星上新型构造活动的证据。
   该团队使用了Magellan探针的观测，从1990年到1994年开始了Venus，并使用雷达映射了表面。之前的特征已经分析，但新的研究使用了一种新的计算机模型，可以识别表明岩石圈中的大块结构的表面变形。这些块是阿拉斯加的大小，似乎已经像池塘或湖泊的破碎的包装冰一样慢慢地慢慢地开始。
  这与地球上的当前类型的板块构造有很大不同。但是，如果确认，它将是Venus内部的热流和熔融材料的证据 - 从未观察过的东西。作者认为，在Archean EON期间与地球的地质有相似之处（2.5至40亿年前）表明，当行星更加接地时，“包装冰”模式可能是从金星的早期板块的过渡。
    这种运动“在金星低地普遍存在，争论以前未被识别的全球构造风格，”哥伦比亚大学研究科学家和新研究的同志师Sean Solomon说。
  调查结果只能燃料在NASA和欧洲航天局最近批准的新金星任务背后的兴奋。所罗门说，他和他的团队希望所有三个都可以提供“用于测试我们纸上描述的想法的关键数据。”这些任务将无法准备好推出，直到越来越近十年结束，所以让我们希望在未来几年内令人兴奋。
note_en:
Venus might be hell, but don’t call it a dead planet. Amid surface temperatures of up to 471 °C and surface pressures 100 times greater than those on Earth, new research suggests the planet might still be geologically active. That’s encouraging news to people who think it  could once have hosted life ( or that it might still be able to).
  Earth’s lithosphere (its crust and upper mantle) is made of “plates” that move around and crash into each other, resulting in mountains, deep ocean trenches, and volcanic and seismic activity. This tectonic activity also plays an important role in the carbon cycle, the processes in which carbon is released and reabsorbed in the ecosystem; by regulating the amount of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere, it has helped keep the planet cool and comfortable this whole time.
  Thus far, scientists have never observed anything similar on Venus. But we’ve never been able to rule it out, because it’s hard to make scientific observations of the planet (its thick clouds obscure its surface, and any spacecraft we’d land there would most likely melt in a matter of hours). In the new findings,  published in PNAS today, scientists think they’ve finally spotted evidence of a new type of tectonic activity on Venus.
   The team used observations made by the Magellan probe, which orbited Venus from 1990 to 1994 and mapped the surface using radar. The features it spotted have been analyzed before, but the new study uses a new computer model that can recognize surface deformations indicating large block structures in the lithosphere. These blocks, each about the size of Alaska, seem to have been sluggishly jostling against each other like broken pack ice on a pond or lake.
  This is quite different from the current type of plate tectonics on Earth. But if confirmed, it would nonetheless be evidence of heat currents and molten material in Venus’s interior—something that’s never before been observed. The authors think parallels with Earth’s geology during the Archean Eon (2.5 to 4 billion years ago) suggest that the “pack ice” patterns could be a transition from an earlier period of plate tectonics on Venus when the planet was more Earth-like.
    This movement “is widespread across the Venus lowlands, and argues for a previously unrecognized style of global tectonics,” says Sean Solomon, a research scientist at Columbia University and a coauthor of the new study.
  The findings only fuel more excitement behind  the new Venus missions recently approved by NASA and the European Space Agency. Solomon says he and his team hope all three can provide “critical data for testing the ideas we’ve described in our paper.” Those missions won’t be ready to launch till closer to the end of the decade, so let’s hope the excitement doesn’t wane over the next several years.
title: 科学家可能在金星内发现了构造活动
title_en: Scientists Might Have Spotted Tectonic Activity Inside Venus
